text: Gammy's Australian father has reportedly
said that doctors didn't tell him that
the surrogate mother he'd employed in
Thailand but had twins he was he says
unaware that the baby girl he took home
to Western Australia had a brother who
has Down syndrome and a serious heart
condition this contradicts the account
given by Pat Ramon chan boa the 21 year
old woman who gave birth to twins in
December she says that everyone involved
in the agreements including the
biological parents medical staff and the
surrogacy agency knew of Gammy's
disabilities when she was four months
pregnant she refused to have an abortion
on religious grounds Gammy's future
appears to lie in Thailand where his
surrogate mother says she'll bring him
up alongside her two other children he's
recently been treated in hospital for a
lung infection an online fundraising
campaign to help pay his medical
expenses has exceeded its target of a
hundred and eighty five thousand dollars
in parts of Australia it's illegal to
pay surrogates overseas although the
laws don't apply in Western Australia
where Gammy's sister lives with her
parents who remain at the heart of a
surrogacy storm Phill Mercer BBC News
Sydney
